text: Mohammad-Reza Shajarian (; , 23 September 1940 – 8 October 2020)BBC Persian Service: Mohammad Reza Shajarian Passes Away Retrieved 8 October 2020. was an Iranian classical singer-songwriter, composer and calligrapher. He was a Master (master) of Persian traditional music.Master of Persian Classical Music: Mohammad Reza Shajarian Retrieved 23 December 2017. His best known single was "Night, Silence, Desert" (2000). In 2017, Los Angeles Times called him as the "greatest living maestro of Persian classical music." He was born in Mashhad, Iran. He supported the 2009 protests in Iran and was a critic of President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad.
